panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: search Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of all document indexing requests on GitLab.com, as measured from ElasticSearch.



### Observability Tools

panels.title: elasticsearch_searching SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of all search queries on GitLab.com, as measured from ElasticSearch.



### Observability Tools

* [ðŸ“– Kibana: Elasticsearch logs](https://00a4ef3362214c44a044feaa539b4686.us-central1.gcp.cloud.es.io:9243/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(elasticsearch.component,event.dataset,message),filters:!((meta:(key:service.name,params:'prod-gitlab-com+indexing-20200330',type:phrase),query:(match:(service.name:(query:'prod-gitlab-com+indexing-20200330',type:phrase))))),index:'3fdde960-1f73-11eb-9ead-c594f004ece2')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
panels.title: Details

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling. The metrics are coming from elasticsearch_exporter.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        avg_over_time(elasticsearch_process_cpu_percent{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}[1m]) / 100
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, host) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, host) (
        (elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"} - elasticsearch_filesystem_data_free_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"})
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, host) (
        elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization Overall

panels.description:
JVM heap memory utilization per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      elasticsearch_jvm_memory_used_bytes{area="heap", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
      /
      elasticsearch_jvm_memory_max_bytes{area="heap", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_jvm_heap_memory component saturation: JVM Heap Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling. The metrics are coming from elasticsearch_exporter.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg_over_time(elasticsearch_process_cpu_percent{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}[5m]) / 100
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        (
          elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
          -
          elasticsearch_filesystem_data_free_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
        )
        /
        elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_single_node_disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Utilization of each thread pool on each node.

Descriptions of the threadpool types can be found at
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-threadpool.html.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name, exported_type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        avg_over_time(elasticsearch_thread_pool_active_count{exported_type!="snapshot", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}[5m])
        /
        (avg_over_time(elasticsearch_thread_pool_threads_count{exported_type!="snapshot", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}[5m]) > 0)
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_thread_pools component saturation: Thread pool utilization

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
